Type Definitions.html#/c:FunkyFilterPred.name: FunkyFilterPredicate

Type Definitions.html#/c:FunkySortCompar.name: FunkySortComparablePropertyProviderBlock
Type Definitions.html#/c:FunkySortCompar.abstract: This is a protocol for comparing objects via a mapped value. In case of complex objects you can return a sub-property which implements the -compare: method, so the collection will be sorted by that computed property.

Classes/FunkySort.html#/c:objc(cs)FunkyS.abstract: Provides a lexicographical comparator, so if the collection is sorted using this method, all the elements should be comparable using the -compare: method

Classes/FunkySort.html#/c:objc(cs)FunkyS.name: +propertyComparator:
Classes/FunkySort.html#/c:objc(cs)FunkyS.abstract: Provides a property comparator, mapping the current object into another comparable one which responds to the -compare: method. In case of a complex object you usually return a property of it which holds a primitive value, like NSString or NSNumber

Classes/FunkySort.html#/c:objc(cs)FunkyS.name: +boolComparator:
Classes/FunkySort.html#/c:objc(cs)FunkyS.abstract: Provides a special comparator for comparing objects, but when only interested in their asending or descending information. It is usually used when comparing numbers in an array, like return obj1 < obj2 to have an ascending collection

Classes/FunkySort.html#/c:objc(cs)FunkyS.name: +prioritizedComparator:
Classes/FunkySort.html#/c:objc(cs)FunkyS.abstract: A composite comparator, providing multiple comparators in it, so when based on one comparation the objects are equal, the next one is being used.

Classes/FunkySort.html#/c:objc(cs)FunkyS.name: +comparatorWithBuckets:
Classes/FunkySort.html#/c:objc(cs)FunkyS.abstract: A composite comparator using buckets. It orders the list in a way, that it uses so called buckets which represent a subset of the elements. So the order is going to be made up of the order of these buckets.

Classes/FunkySort.html#/c:objc(cs)FunkyS.name: +comparatorWithBuckets:defaultInnerBucketComparator:
Classes/FunkySort.html#/c:objc(cs)FunkyS.abstract: Same as +[FunkySort comparatorWithBuckets:] but with an addition to set the default inner bucket comparator.

Classes/FunkyNSArraySubclass.html.name: FunkyNSArraySubclass
Classes/FunkyNSArraySubclass.html.abstract: This is a subclass of the NSArray class-cluster, overriding the minimum set of getters and setters in order to further subclassing it, customizing the behaviour. This particular class is equivalent of an NSArray, as the implementation uses NSArray for the backing store.

Classes/FunkyNSMutableArraySubclass.html.name: FunkyNSMutableArraySubclass

This particular class is equivalent of an NSMutableArray, as the implementation uses NSMutableArray for the backing store.

Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)FunkyNilStoringN.name: FunkyNilStoringNSArray
Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)FunkyNilStoringN.abstract: This is a subclass of the NSArray class-cluster, providing nil-storing behaviour to NSArray. Whenever you would insert nil values into the set, it will insert them instead of crashing. You can also get back these values via the getters.

Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)FunkyNilStoringN.name: FunkyNilStoringNSMutableArray

Categories/NSMutableSet(FunkyPrefixedUti.name: -funky_takeUnion:
Categories/NSMutableSet(FunkyPrefixedUti.abstract: Takes the union of the two sets

Categories/NSMutableSet(FunkyPrefixedUti.name: -funky_takeMinus:
Categories/NSMutableSet(FunkyPrefixedUti.abstract: Takes the minus of the two sets by taking the current minus the provided one.

Categories/NSMutableSet(FunkyPrefixedUti.name: -funky_takeIntersection:
Categories/NSMutableSet(FunkyPrefixedUti.abstract: Takes the intersection of the two sets.

Categories/NSMutableSet(FunkyPrefixedUti.name: -funky_filter:
Categories/NSMutableSet(FunkyPrefixedUti.abstract: Filters the set using the given predicate, keeping the elements that are passing the test.

Categories/NSMutableSet(FunkyPrefixedUti.name: -funky_flatten
Categories/NSMutableSet(FunkyPrefixedUti.abstract: Makes the set structure a squence with flat elements, containing no NSSets

Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).name: -funky_all:
Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).abstract: Returns whether the condition matches all elements in the set

Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).name: -funky_none:
Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).abstract: Returns whether the condition matches no elements in the set

Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).name: -funky_contains:
Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).abstract: Returns whether the condition matches at least one element in the set

Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).name: -funky_count:
Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).abstract: Returns the number of elements the given condition matches in the set, like if you would filter the set.

Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).name: -funky_map:
Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).abstract: Returns a new NSSet instance with the same amount of elements, where each element is transformed to another by returning a new object in the block parameter.

Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).name: -funky_nilTolerantMap:
Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).abstract: Returns a new NSSet instance where each element is transformed to another by returning a new object in the block parameter. It ignores the nil parameters returned from the block.

Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).name: -funky_flatMap:
Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).abstract: Returns a new NSSet instance with the same amount of elements, where each element is transformed to another by returning a new object in the block parameter. Same as map, but the result is going to be flattened, so if you return an NSSet any iteration, it is going to be converted into a flat structure, not an set of sets.

Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).name: -funky_filtered:
Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).abstract: Returns a new NSSet instance with the element, that are passing the returned expression in the original set.

Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).name: -funky_flattened
Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).abstract: Flattens the set, meaning that if it consisted of Set items, they are going to be flattened into one flat structure of elements. An set of sets will transform to an set of elements from each of the previous sets. This computation is performed deeply, meaning that it contontued flattening elements, until they produce a flat structure.

Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).name: -funky_takingUnion:
Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).abstract: Takes the union of the two sets.

Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).name: -funky_takingMinus:
Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).abstract: Takes a set which is the current minus the provided one.

Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).name: -funky_takingIntersection:
Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).abstract: Takes the intersection of the two sets.

Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).name: -funky_forEach:
Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).abstract: Calls every element of the set once.

Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).name: -funky_groupBy:
Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).abstract: Groups elements to an NSDictionary, where the returned element serves as a key, and the objects as the value. If multiple elements are returned with the same key, the result (of which is going to get included) is unpredicatble.

Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).name: -funky_associateBy:
Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).abstract: Groups elements to an NSDictionary, where the returned element serves as a key, and the objects as the value. The elements in the resulting Dictionary are sets, so if multiple elements return the same keys, all of them are going to be included in the value.

Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).name: -funky_reduce:withInitialValue:
Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).abstract: Produces an aggregated value based on the elements of the set.

Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).name: -funky_sum:
Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).abstract: A special use-case of reduce, which summarises the returned double values for each element in the set.

Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).name: -funky_average:
Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).abstract: A special use-case of reduce, which takes the average value of the returned double values for each element in the set.

Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).name: -funky_minValue:
Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).abstract: A special use-case of reduce, which takes the minimum of the returned double values for each element in the set.

Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).name: -funky_maxValue:
Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).abstract: A special use-case of reduce, which takes the maximum of the returned double values for each element in the set.

Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).name: -funky_minItems:
Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).abstract: Returns an set with all the minimal value elements in the set, where the minimum was computed by the returned double value for each element in the set.

Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).name: -funky_maxItems:
Categories/NSSet(FunkyPrefixedUtilities).abstract: Returns an set with all the maximal value elements in the set, where the maximum was computed by the returned double value for each element in the set.

Categories/NSObject(FunkyPrefixedUtiliti.name: -funky_apply:
Categories/NSObject(FunkyPrefixedUtiliti.abstract: Applies some logic on the current object and returns it afterwards.

Categories/NSMutableDictionary(FunkyPref.name: -funky_merge:
Categories/NSMutableDictionary(FunkyPref.abstract: Concatenates the current dictinoary (in place) with the one given in the parameter. It does this by putting the existing elements first, and the elements in the provided dictionary afterwards.

Categories/NSMutableDictionary(FunkyPref.name: -funky_filter:
Categories/NSMutableDictionary(FunkyPref.abstract: Filters the dictionary (in palce) using the given predicate, keeping the elements that are passing the test.

Categories/NSDictionary(FunkyPrefixedUti.name: -funky_map:
Categories/NSDictionary(FunkyPrefixedUti.abstract: Returns a new NSDictionary instance with the same amount of elements, where each element is transformed to another by returning a new object in the block parameter.

Categories/NSDictionary(FunkyPrefixedUti.name: -funky_nilTolerantMap:
Categories/NSDictionary(FunkyPrefixedUti.abstract: Returns a new NSDictionary instance where each element is transformed to another by returning a new object in the block parameter. It ignores the nil parameters returned from the block.

Categories/NSDictionary(FunkyPrefixedUti.name: -funky_merged:
Categories/NSDictionary(FunkyPrefixedUti.abstract: Returns a new NSDictionary instance, in which concatenates the two dictionaries by putting the existing elements first, and the elements in the provided dictionary after them.

Categories/NSDictionary(FunkyPrefixedUti.name: -funky_forEach:
Categories/NSDictionary(FunkyPrefixedUti.abstract: Calls every element of the dictionary once.

Categories/NSDictionary(FunkyPrefixedUti.name: -funky_invertedObjectsAndKeys
Categories/NSDictionary(FunkyPrefixedUti.abstract: Returns a new NSDictionary instance, in which uses the current values as the dictionary and keys and vice-versa. If multiple values are holding the same key, the result (which key is used) is unpredictable.

Categories/NSDictionary(FunkyPrefixedUti.name: -funky_filtered:
Categories/NSDictionary(FunkyPrefixedUti.abstract: Filters the dictionary using the given predicate, keeping the elements that are passing the test.

Categories/NSDictionary(FunkyPrefixedUti.name: -funky_all:
Categories/NSDictionary(FunkyPrefixedUti.abstract: Returns whether the condition matches all elements in the dictionary

Categories/NSDictionary(FunkyPrefixedUti.name: -funky_none:
Categories/NSDictionary(FunkyPrefixedUti.abstract: Returns whether the condition matches no elements in the dictionary

Categories/NSDictionary(FunkyPrefixedUti.name: -funky_contains:
Categories/NSDictionary(FunkyPrefixedUti.abstract: Returns whether the condition matches at least one element in the dictionary

Categories/NSDictionary(FunkyPrefixedUti.name: -funky_count:
Categories/NSDictionary(FunkyPrefixedUti.abstract: Returns the number of elements the given condition matches in the dictionary, like if you would filter the dictionary.

Categories/NSDictionary(FunkyPrefixedUti.name: -funky_reduce:withInitialValue:
Categories/NSDictionary(FunkyPrefixedUti.abstract: Produces an aggregated value based on the elements of the dictionary.

Categories/NSDictionary(FunkyPrefixedUti.name: -funky_keys:
Categories/NSDictionary(FunkyPrefixedUti.abstract: Returns all the keys where the given predicate matches the elements of the dictionary.

Categories/NSDictionary(FunkyPrefixedUti.name: -funky_values:
Categories/NSDictionary(FunkyPrefixedUti.abstract: Returns all the values where the given predicate matches the elements of the dictionary.

Categories/NSMutableArray(FunkyPrefixedU.name: -funky_flatten
Categories/NSMutableArray(FunkyPrefixedU.abstract: Makes the array structure a squence with flat elements, containing no NSArrays

Categories/NSMutableArray(FunkyPrefixedU.name: -funky_reverse
Categories/NSMutableArray(FunkyPrefixedU.abstract: Puts the containing items (in place) in a reversed order.

Categories/NSMutableArray(FunkyPrefixedU.name: -funky_shuffle
Categories/NSMutableArray(FunkyPrefixedU.abstract: Shuffles the containing items (in place) in a random fashion.

Categories/NSMutableArray(FunkyPrefixedU.name: -funky_removeDuplicates
Categories/NSMutableArray(FunkyPrefixedU.abstract: Makes the array unique (in place) by removing the duplicated items from the containing items. The method does this keeping the first occurence and removes the further duplications.

Categories/NSMutableArray(FunkyPrefixedU.name: -funky_merge:
Categories/NSMutableArray(FunkyPrefixedU.abstract: Concatenates the current array (in place) with the one given in the parameter. It does this by putting the existing elements first, and the elements in the provided array afterwards.

Categories/NSMutableArray(FunkyPrefixedU.name: -funky_sort:
Categories/NSMutableArray(FunkyPrefixedU.abstract: Sorts the array (in place) using the given comparator.

Categories/NSMutableArray(FunkyPrefixedU.name: -funky_filter:
Categories/NSMutableArray(FunkyPrefixedU.abstract: Filters the array using the given predicate, keeping the elements that are passing the test.

Categories/NSMutableArray(FunkyPrefixedU.name: +funky_arrayWithItem:repeated:
Categories/NSMutableArray(FunkyPrefixedU.abstract: Creates a mutable array by repeating the same item by repeat number of times. The size of the array is going to be qual to repeat, only consisting of item objects.

Categories/NSMutableArray(FunkyPrefixedU.name: +funky_arrayWithArray:nextItem:repeated:
Categories/NSMutableArray(FunkyPrefixedU.abstract: Creates a mutable array by taking an initial array and computing the next items by repeatedly putting the result of block by repeated number of times.

Categories/NSMutableArray(FunkyPrefixedU.name: +funky_arrayWithArray:nextItem:until:
Categories/NSMutableArray(FunkyPrefixedU.abstract: Creates a mutable array by taking an initial array and computing the next items by repeatedly putting the result of block by until the block parameter until returns YES.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_all:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Returns whether the condition matches all elements in the array

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_none:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Returns whether the condition matches no elements in the array

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_contains:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Returns whether the condition matches at least one element in the array

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_count:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Returns the number of elements the given condition matches in the array, like if you would filter the array.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_map:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Returns a new NSArray instance with the same amount of elements, where each element is transformed to another by returning a new object in the block parameter.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_nilTolerantMap:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Returns a new NSArray instance where each element is transformed to another by returning a new object in the block parameter. It ignores the nil parameters returned from the block.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_mapWithIndex:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Same as map, but the block contains the index of the current element.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_nilTolerantMapWithIndex:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Same as nil-tolerant map, but the block contains the index of the current element.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_flatMap:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Returns a new NSArray instance with the same amount of elements, where each element is transformed to another by returning a new object in the block parameter. Same as map, but the result is going to be flattened, so if you return an NSArray any iteration, it is going to be converted into a flat structure, not an array of arrays.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_flatMapWithIndex:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Same as flatMap, but the block contains the index of the current element.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_filtered:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Returns a new NSArray instance with the element, that are passing the returned expression in the original array.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_flattened
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Flattens the array, meaning that if it consisted of Array items, they are going to be flattened into one flat structure of elements. An array of arrays will transform to an array of elements from each of the previous arrays. This computation is performed deeply, meaning that it contontued flattening elements, until they produce a flat structure.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_merged:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Returns a new NSArray instance, in which concatenates the two arrays by putting the existing elements first, and the elements in the provided array after them.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_forEach:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Calls every element of the array once.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_forEachWithIndex:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Calls every element of the array once. Same as forEach, but the block contains the index of the current element as well.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_groupByUsingFirst:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Groups elements to an NSDictionary, where the returned element serves as a key, and the objects as the value. If multiple elements are returned with the same key, this function will use the first matching element.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_groupByUsingLast:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Groups elements to an NSDictionary, where the returned element serves as a key, and the objects as the value. If multiple elements are returned with the same key, this function will use the last matching element.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_associateBy:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Groups elements to an NSDictionary, where the returned element serves as a key, and the objects as the value. The elements in the resulting Dictionary are arrays, so if multiple elements return the same keys, all of them are going to be included in the value.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_reduce:withInitialValue:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Produces an aggregated value based on the elements of the array.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_sum:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: A special use-case of reduce, which summarises the returned double values for each element in the array.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_average:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: A special use-case of reduce, which takes the average value of the returned double values for each element in the array.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_minValue:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: A special use-case of reduce, which takes the minimum of the returned double values for each element in the array.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_maxValue:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: A special use-case of reduce, which takes the maximum of the returned double values for each element in the array.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_minItems:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Returns an array with all the minimal value elements in the array, where the minimum was computed by the returned double value for each element in the array.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_maxItems:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Returns an array with all the maximal value elements in the array, where the maximum was computed by the returned double value for each element in the array.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_firstIndex
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Returns the first index of the array: 0

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_lastIndex

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_first:

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_firstIndex:

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_last:

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_lastIndex:

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_take:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Returns an array of the values where the predicate matches, but only until it’s a consecutive sequence. Once the predicate returns NO, those elements are going to be dropped.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_takeLast:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Returns an array of the values where the predicate matches, but only the last consecutive sequence of these element. Same as take, but from the end of the array.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_fromValueExclusive:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Returns an array of the values starting from the given object, not including the object itself. If the given object does not exist in the array, the result is going to be an empty NSArray.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_fromValueInclusive:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Returns an array of the values starting from the given object, including the object itself. If the given object does not exist in the array, the result is going to be an empty NSArray.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_fromIndexExclusive:

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_fromIndexInclusive:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Returns an array of the values starting from the given index, including the object at the fiven index. If the given index does not exist in the array, the result is going to be an empty NSArray.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_untilValueExclusive:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Returns an array of the values until the given object, not including the object itself. If the given object does not exist in the array, the result is going to be an empty NSArray.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_untilValueInclusive:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Returns an array of the values until the given object, including the object itself. If the given object does not exist in the array, the result is going to be an empty NSArray.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_untilIndexExclusive:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Returns an array of the values until the given index, not including the object at the given index. If the given index does not exist in the array, the result is going to be an empty NSArray.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_untilIndexInclusive:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Returns an array of the values until the given index, including the object at the fiven index. If the given index does not exist in the array, the result is going to be an empty NSArray.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_fromValueExclusive:untilValueExclusive:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Returns an array of the values between the given two input objects, excluding both from the result set.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_fromValueExclusive:untilValueInclusive:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Returns an array of the values between the given two input objects, excluding from, including until from the result set.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_fromValueInclusive:untilValueExclusive:

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_fromValueInclusive:untilValueInclusive:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Returns an array of the values between the given two input objects, including both from the result set.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_fromIndexExclusive:untilIndexExclusive:

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_fromIndexExclusive:untilIndexInclusive:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Returns an array of the values between the given two indices, excluding the object at the index from, including the one at the index until from the result set.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_fromIndexInclusive:untilIndexExclusive:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Returns an array of the values between the given two indices, including the object at the index from, excluding the one at the index until from the result set.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.name: -funky_fromIndexInclusive:untilIndexInclusive:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyPrefixedUtilitie.abstract: Returns an array of the values between the given two indices, including both objects (at the given indices) from the result set.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -flatMap:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Returns a new NSArray instance with the same amount of elements, where each element is transformed to another by returning a new object in the block parameter. Same as map, but the result is going to be flattened, so if you return an NSArray any iteration, it is going to be converted into a flat structure, not an array of arrays.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -flatMapWithIndex:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Same as flatMap, but the block contains the index of the current element.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -filtered:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Returns a new NSArray instance with the element, that are passing the returned expression in the original array.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -flattened
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Flattens the array, meaning that if it consisted of Array items, they are going to be flattened into one flat structure of elements. An array of arrays will transform to an array of elements from each of the previous arrays. This computation is performed deeply, meaning that it contontued flattening elements, until they produce a flat structure.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -merged:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Returns a new NSArray instance, in which concatenates the two arrays by putting the existing elements first, and the elements in the provided array after them.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -forEach:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Calls every element of the array once.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -forEachWithIndex:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Calls every element of the array once. Same as forEach, but the block contains the index of the current element as well.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -groupByUsingFirst:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Groups elements to an NSDictionary, where the returned element serves as a key, and the objects as the value. If multiple elements are returned with the same key, this function will use the first matching element.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -groupByUsingLast:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Groups elements to an NSDictionary, where the returned element serves as a key, and the objects as the value. If multiple elements are returned with the same key, this function will use the last matching element.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -associateBy:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Groups elements to an NSDictionary, where the returned element serves as a key, and the objects as the value. The elements in the resulting Dictionary are arrays, so if multiple elements return the same keys, all of them are going to be included in the value.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -reduce:withInitialValue:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Produces an aggregated value based on the elements of the array.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -sum:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: A special use-case of reduce, which summarises the returned double values for each element in the array.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -average:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: A special use-case of reduce, which takes the average value of the returned double values for each element in the array.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -minValue:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: A special use-case of reduce, which takes the minimum of the returned double values for each element in the array.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -maxValue:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: A special use-case of reduce, which takes the maximum of the returned double values for each element in the array.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -minItems:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Returns an array with all the minimal value elements in the array, where the minimum was computed by the returned double value for each element in the array.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -maxItems:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Returns an array with all the maximal value elements in the array, where the maximum was computed by the returned double value for each element in the array.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -firstIndex
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Returns the first index of the array: 0

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -lastIndex
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Returns the last index of the array: count - 1

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -first:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Returns the first element, where the predicate matches

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -firstIndex:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Returns the index of the first element, where the predicate matches

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -last:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Returns the last element, where the predicate matches

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -lastIndex:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Returns the index of the last element, where the predicate matches

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -take:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Returns an array of the values where the predicate matches, but only until it’s a consecutive sequence. Once the predicate returns NO, those elements are going to be dropped.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -takeLast:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Returns an array of the values where the predicate matches, but only the last consecutive sequence of these element. Same as take, but from the end of the array.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -fromValueExclusive:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Returns an array of the values starting from the given object, not including the object itself. If the given object does not exist in the array, the result is going to be an empty NSArray.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -fromValueInclusive:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Returns an array of the values starting from the given object, including the object itself. If the given object does not exist in the array, the result is going to be an empty NSArray.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -fromIndexExclusive:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Returns an array of the values starting from the given index, not including the object at the given index. If the given index does not exist in the array, the result is going to be an empty NSArray.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -fromIndexInclusive:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Returns an array of the values starting from the given index, including the object at the fiven index. If the given index does not exist in the array, the result is going to be an empty NSArray.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -untilValueExclusive:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Returns an array of the values until the given object, not including the object itself. If the given object does not exist in the array, the result is going to be an empty NSArray.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -untilValueInclusive:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Returns an array of the values until the given object, including the object itself. If the given object does not exist in the array, the result is going to be an empty NSArray.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -untilIndexExclusive:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Returns an array of the values until the given index, not including the object at the given index. If the given index does not exist in the array, the result is going to be an empty NSArray.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -untilIndexInclusive:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Returns an array of the values until the given index, including the object at the fiven index. If the given index does not exist in the array, the result is going to be an empty NSArray.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -fromValueExclusive:untilValueExclusive:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Returns an array of the values between the given two input objects, excluding both from the result set.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -fromValueExclusive:untilValueInclusive:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Returns an array of the values between the given two input objects, excluding from, including until from the result set.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -fromValueInclusive:untilValueExclusive:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Returns an array of the values between the given two input objects, including from, excluding until from the result set.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -fromValueInclusive:untilValueInclusive:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Returns an array of the values between the given two input objects, including both from the result set.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -fromIndexExclusive:untilIndexExclusive:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Returns an array of the values between the given two indices, excluding both objects (at the given indices) from the result set.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -fromIndexExclusive:untilIndexInclusive:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Returns an array of the values between the given two indices, excluding the object at the index from, including the one at the index until from the result set.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -fromIndexInclusive:untilIndexExclusive:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Returns an array of the values between the given two indices, including the object at the index from, excluding the one at the index until from the result set.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -fromIndexInclusive:untilIndexInclusive:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Returns an array of the values between the given two indices, including both objects (at the given indices) from the result set.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -unique
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Returns an array where is object is unique, so the resulting array does not contain any duplicates.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -reversed
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Returns an array where the items are in a reversed order.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -shuffled
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Returns an array where the items are shuffled randomly.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: -sorted:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Returns an array sorted using the given comparator.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: +arrayWithItem:repeated:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Creates an array by repeating the same item by repeat number of times. The size of the array is going to be qual to repeat, only consisting of item objects.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: +arrayWithArray:nextItem:repeated:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Creates an array by taking an initial array and computing the next items by repeatedly putting the result of block by repeated number of times.

Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.name: +arrayWithArray:nextItem:until:
Categories/NSArray(FunkyUtilities).html#.abstract: Creates an array by taking an initial array and computing the next items by repeatedly putting the result of block by until the block parameter until returns YES.
